His comments on were quoted by Italy's Corriere della Sera, prompting the mayor of Turin, Fiat's birthplace, to demand "immediate clarification." It's clear that an international group can have several offices but it would be different if the headquarters were in the United States, Sergio Marchionne said. A number of leading politicians also expressed indignation, and ANSA news agency said talks were planned next week between Sergio Marchionne and Economic Development Minister Paolo Romani .
